author: PikaLink91

text: @SupraDarky Do you have any idea of where I could find the rest of this GB OST? There used to be a full one on Youtube, but I can't find it anywhere now. I'm not sure if you rip stuff yourself, or you find all this music online, but if you have any suggestions for sites to check, etc., I'd appreciate it! Btw, love your channel! It's pretty much been the soundtrack to my grad school studies for the last three years!

author: ZeRafut

text: @ZeRafut For what it's worth, I recently found a .gbs file of this OST here: http://www.zophar.net/music/gbs/tintin-in-tibet-gbc-.html. The only catch is that you have to open it in a player that can read this file type. I found Bleep! to be the best and most user-friendly (which you can download here: http://www.zophar.net/utilities/audio-multi/bleep-.html)! Hope this helps.
author: bobsagetluvr1

text:
@bobsagetluvr1 
There you go:
http://downloads.khinsider.com/game-soundtracks/album/tintin-in-tibet-gb-

An when you wanna play and export gbs-files or spc-files from zophar's domain, pleas try AudioOverload: http://www.bannister.org/software/ao.htm

text:
just go watch it. 
If you liked the Books you will also like the movie. It's a great mix of some of the books. The thing i love most is the fact it starts out in Brussels , and i live there :3

text: I haven't seen the Tintin movie yet, I've heard good and bad things about it. I read all the Tintin comics and watched the whole series as a kid, loved it and a big part of my childhood. This is one of the many Infogrames games composed by Gonzalez. Funny how Tintin was called Tim on the NA boxart.
